page.title: 12Winterborne Monkton
page.content: Winterborne Monkton lies in the shadow of Maiden Castle. It is a quiet little place not really on the way to anywhere although an unclassified road does twist beneath the great earthworks of Maiden Castle, leading to Martinstown. The village was first named after the River Winterborne which flows through the village. Winterborne means winter flowing stream. These are caused by a fault in the chalk, forming springs in the winter. In the summer these springs dry up. Monkton means a village of monks. The village belonged to the Clunac Friary of Le Vaast near Boulogne from the early 13th century.
